website_summaries.verdict: A slim, smart TV with crisp color and quick action in a size that's practical. Comes at a price that is also appealing.
pros: Features a slim build in a 50-inch model that works well in mid-size rooms
UHD resolution and fast refresh rate make it ideal for gaming
Price is on the lower end of the spectrum
cons: Views from angles are somewhat limited, and sound quality is lacking

customer_reviews.title: Amazing TV
customer_reviews.text: This tv is awesome. Thought it had 4 hdmi ports, but I bought a splitter so that should fix the problem. Games and movies look amazing. Also, if your soundbar is Samsung it will find or request to connect to the tv instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Marwin C.

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Samsung 8 series TU8000 50”. After un-packing I found that the 50” I purchased was actual 44”. How’s that! The box is only 49” there no way with the foam protection the TV could be 50”. See pictures and video. This is a scam. I need my money or a 50” Samsung TV
customer_reviews.author: adonis betances

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tv for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tv, easy to use and setup and my games looking amazing
customer_reviews.author: Chassidy

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement TV
customer_reviews.text: I used to own the Samsung MU6300 but in February it fell and the screen cracked. So when I was looking for a new TV I saw this one but it didn't have many reviews at the time nor positive ones. But I took a chance and I love the TV; the bezels are thinner and the picture is actually pretty good. They also have all the apps that I needed and use. I know some people have said it's too dark sometimes but I don't really have that problem day time or night; you can always switch the picture to dynamic anyways. Overall it's great and I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Iasia Lorick

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this motherboard and remote were blown according to the Comcast guy and getting Amazon to even respond was a complete complete complete exercise in futility. I ended up giving it away in Hope's someone could make use of it. This is the very first negative review I have ever written and I am 68 yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: John Maccorkindale

customer_reviews.title: Bright, sharp picture and good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy setup..sharp picture quality. Easily set up Amazon Prime, Roku, Hulu and Starz. I also installed a Roku soundbar and subwoofer...took about 3 hours, but only because I had forgotten a few of my passwords. The sound on the TV was a lot better than my previous TV..but I wanted to add wireless audio capability to my system.
customer_reviews.author: marshakar56

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality!  TV legs won't go in due to defective hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited to start assembling the TV but was soon left annoyed with how the left leg stand won't go in. On inspection, we found a screw inside defective and bent, not allowing the leg to fit in. Looks like just a bent screw but unless the leg goes in, how do I set up the TV? Went through the cumbersome unpackaging and re-packaging process. Would have opted for white glove delivery if there was an option but there clearly isn't. Paid so much for a horrible exp. Terrible quality. Started a return...DO NOT RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Ammy

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 TVs. Both came delivered with internal screen damage. Bad manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: It's a piece of trash is what it is!!!
customer_reviews.text: We just received the TV this morning. Everything was fine setting it up and logging in to the apps and stuff. Turned it off for a few hours, and tried to turn on in the evening for some TV, and the screen would not turn on! We could hear the sound, but there were no pictures showing. Tried turning off and on, unplugging and plugging in, nothing worked. Called Amazon customer service, not helpful at all (this is weird because they are usually very helpful). Anyways I'm returning this piece of trash and getting another brand. First time getting a Samsung product and this is what I got. Never buy Samsung again!
customer_reviews.author: X. Y

customer_reviews.title: Don't order a tv online.
customer_reviews.text: No picture. Useless tv. I've ordered two tv from Amazon and both were received broken.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Mulvaney

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tv for a couple of reasons. One because the price was decent. Two because it being an 8000 series I figured that it had to be just as good, if not, better than the 2019 8000 series. The user menu seems like there is some sort of delay when switching through the apps. I’ve had issues with the WiFi connecting to the tv. A few of the apps wouldn’t connect/load, one of them being Netflix and the other one was the spectrum app. The picture quality isn’t as nice as it is on the 2019 model.
customer_reviews.author: ambie_1985

customer_reviews.title: Unremovable ads, YouTube limited to 720p.
customer_reviews.text: What's the point in a smart TV if it's not very smart? YouTube was quality limited, ads are enforced (the worst is that if you don't interact for ~60 seconds when not playing, it closes your app and shows ads!). The Crunchyroll app was removed because Samsung sucks. I'd return this piece of junk, but am going to test a FireStick with it first. Good TV -- terrible smart TV.
customer_reviews.author: Max B.

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this tv. The color is very dull and after only having it about 3 weeks I started noticing a weird green shadow around many of the images on screen. Also, the optical cord out option would not recognize my stereo receiver. I’ve always trusted Samsung products but after this I will look at their competitors for a new tv. Very disappointing especially for the money spent on it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sher

customer_reviews.title: 4 Red dots and red smear on screen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this TV and it arrived on March 19th. Because if the Covid 19 virus I wasnt able to get it set up until yesterday May 16th....I'm so upset..the screen has 4 red dots on it and a red smear area. Hopefully Samsung can either fix this or exchange it. I contacted them directly and they said they would send someone out this upcoming week. I will updated this and let you know what the outcome is.
customer_reviews.author: Karen E.

customer_reviews.title: Great tv for the half hour I used it before it died
customer_reviews.text: Well let’s see. Received tv today. Set up was easy. Picture and sound quality good. However, the screen went blank 30 minutes in to watching a movie. Samsung customer support totally unhelpful and bordering on incompetent. Amazon customer support processed a replacement and a pick up of the defective model. They were very helpful. Let’s see how it works out.
customer_reviews.author: Noah D Silverman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you are hanging this tv
customer_reviews.text: The tv legs are so wide that they don’t fit on most tv stands or dressers. Sony’s legs are much closer together. Plus— since redesigning from the previous center support, the engineers created an even bigger problem. Tipovers increased after they redesigned to wide legs because because kids now knock them right off their furniture due to the extreme width of the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - slow responding remote / app won't work
customer_reviews.text: This sucks. I can't get the Spectrum app to work. It worked for a few weeks.. Now the app won't start. I unplugged. Then I reset the TV and after putting in all the passwords again, the app still won't load. Can't believe I have to box this up and take it to UPS. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Josh A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect condition
customer_reviews.text: As far as the TV goes, it's great. No complaints. I'm only putting in a review because I was terrified of buying a TV online. We all have our own stories, but mine came in perfect condition. And trust me, I was extremely scared to buy online, but under the circumstances was left with no other option. Ordered it and it came a few days early. Once again, perfect condition. As far as the TV goes, it has beautiful picture and decent sound. Overall I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Had to order a replacement
customer_reviews.text: Just received the tv today and right out of the box it has lines running vertical near the middle of the tv.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Sawyers

customer_reviews.title: Too dark to watch
customer_reviews.text: The picture was too sharp and unrealistic looking. the dark areas bothered me. They were almost solid black with absolutely no detail in them. The colors are vivid and unrealistic. I went through all the settings and couldn't improve the image. I requested a refund right away. I took a picture of the image on the tv, the second image is from the Sony 950 that i bought to replace the Samsung
customer_reviews.author: DK fá

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Finally Took Care of Me
customer_reviews.text: I received this TV without a remote, power cord or legs. After feeling left out in the cold by both Amazon and Samsung (partly due to COVID-19 restrictions), Amazon finally stepped up and fixed the problem. Could have been easier but ultimately, kudos.
customer_reviews.author: Don Moulton

customer_reviews.title: Another problem TV from Samsung
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace my 55 inch curved screen way too soon. The 55 inch replacement is not working 19 days after purchase. Samsung support was useless solving the issue. They told me it needed to go to a Samsung repair center for replacement parts. I gave it to a friend who performed a factory reset. The tech was wrong. I bought a NEW Samsung 8 series it is malfunctioning at 19 days old. It will no access Prime Video even though the app is built in to the TV and has a Prime button on the remote. Called Samsung support and have been waiting for a call back.
customer_reviews.author: VW

customer_reviews.title: Remote will not pair with the TV
customer_reviews.text: After several hours of effort, the remote will not pair with the TV. Chat with support was unsuccessful. Dealing with the telephone support to try to get a new remote sent.
customer_reviews.author: John D Northup

customer_reviews.title: check the model you get , my 1st one wasnt the one on the box
customer_reviews.text: 1st TV i had received didn't work out the box so it was sent back , next TV i received was different and at least worked . If you order this TV check to make sure its the right model when you get it . BTW both boxes were the same and like i said the TVs were different ... great picture , sound is great ,remote is fast with no lagging as most do when they work with Samsung smart hub app( rubbish ) . Over all i am very happy with the TV despite the previous shenanigans.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with what seems to be a crack within the TV screen. It does not turn on, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The good, the bad, and the ugly - after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The Good: great picture, very intuitive remote, lightweight so easy to hang on the all, small bezel The Bad: shipped saying Ambient mode would display your own pictures but took 3 months of begging for them to make it happen on my .... iPhone 6 The Ugly: the Tizen OS often does not get apps written until last or never gets them Bottom line: not a bad purchase but I think equivalent TCL's will give you more bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this tv
customer_reviews.text: This TV was surprisingly easy to set up. I was even able to use the power cord from my older Samsung TV. I did however need to go to the store and pick up longer screws for my existing tv wall-mount though. The picture quality is great, as is the sound. The remote is simple to use and Alexa responds well. Although there are some pre-loaded apps on the home screen, that I can’t figure out yet how to remove, I can add new ones and move them to the front of the list. I would recommend purchasing this tv to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Jones

customer_reviews.title: Screen has a small problem
customer_reviews.text: Love the TV! Great Smart features, Samsung gives you free TV channels, really nice picture quality, the remote is cheap but acceptable...just has a small problem on the side of the screen. It looks like either a slight factory defect or it took a hit in shipping. Not worth the hassle of returning. Packaging could definitely been better, shipped in original box with no extra padding.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: No amazon prime working app.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these TVs a month apart. Most recent purchase I ended up on the phone with amazon and Samsung for almost 2 hours. Bottom line, Amazon Prime app is defective. They cannot get the app to load. basically is one of the main reasons I ordered the TV. Completely useless tech support. And you know how much a pain it is to send something like this back once it is up on the wall. All other apps work. Will attempt to download Roku app which I already have an account and watch Amazon Prime. According to Samsung and Amazon, they were well aware of issue, yet let them be sold. Unbelievable. Poor poor poor failure in every way.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Overrated, just buy the Hisense H8G (and read the technical reviews)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thinking it was a no-brainer but decided to return it when I did more homework. Check the reviews on this set and the H8G on RTINGS . The Hisense beats this TV in almost every category and is cheaper. The Hisense also has a variable analog audio out which is great when this is a spare set. Finally, the advertising in the Samsung and the lousy menu are just plain annoying, like they really suck. The only advantage I can find to the Samsung is eARC support and TrueHD out over ARC, but this is a spare TV for us and not a full-blown 5 channel home theater setup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Samsung will not honor inhouse warranty DO NOT BUY THIS TV
customer_reviews.text: This TV arrived Aug 14. No picture by Aug 18. Called Amazon who referred us to Samsung. This TV has inhouse service warranty. Samsung said they would be here to fix it Aug 25. On Aug 24 they called to say they would not come. They say TV has to be shipped back to them and received BEFORE they would do anything else. Bottom line, they say new TV arrival in 4 weeks. And the new one would not have a new 1 year warranty but only continue from date of purchase which was Aug 10. Do not buy this TV.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: A REALLY STUPID REMOTE
customer_reviews.text: TV works fine. The remote is another matter. First it's TOO SMALL. How a normal person's fingers are supposed to move around the UNMARKED buttons (only symbols you have to memorize) I do not understand. I just couldn't get over it. WHY IS IT SO SMALL? WHY AREN'T THINGS MARKED? It looks very space age but operationally, it's like a spaceship with no doors or a beer mug without a handle. Hate it
customer_reviews.author: Jay Day

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement for my nine year old tv with blown speakers
customer_reviews.text: The new remote and the upgraded features were excellent. Using Alexa was a disappointment because it does not do much or work well. I was not happy with the drab screen display, until I realize you could control much of the output. I raised the color and tint on the setting mode, and changed the pix to dynamic instead of standard. Wound up with exactly the picture I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great tv for the price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older early Hitachi 42" plasma which I loved. I was hesitant on doing anything LCD/UHD/whatever they are. But plasmas are no more and already kind of antiquated tech. Plus the 42" weighed a friggen ton. Because of my reluctance, that's probably why I didn't want to spend a lot on my first tv in years. Pleasantly surprised at the features, ease of us, quality, even the sound of this thing. And it weighs next to nothing. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: jg

customer_reviews.title: The television arrived with a broken screen!
customer_reviews.text: I have never experienced anything like this before. When I turned on the television, the picture showed that the screen was clearly damaged. Completely unacceptable! Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: A big step backwards
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded to a newer Samsung for the software. I have impaired hearing and rely on Bluetooth headphones to listen while my wife watches with normal audio from the TV speakers. The TV has built in Bluetooth but you have to select one or the other. Can't use Bluetooth and TV speakers at the same time. In fact you can't use digital audio cable and Bluetooth only. One audio output selected in setup. This is worse than the TV we replaced. A Samsung that is 8 years old. Sounds like going backwards to me. She likes the newer software so we keep it. Guess I will give up watching or maybe install the old TV in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick E. Hutchings

customer_reviews.title: This. TV. Is. Trash.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this TV for 18 DAYS and already having issues! This TV came highly recommended and IT. IS. TRASH. It won't stay connected to the internet. Reset router = check! Unplugged and re-plugged router = check! Unplug and re-plugged TV = check! TV stills says no network connection. WTF! Internet working on everything else in this house, except for...Wait. For. It...The $697.99 TV! trash...trASH...TRASH! Save. Yo. Coins. Samsung think we got money to waste. If I had a way to return this piece of junk...I. WOULD!
customer_reviews.author: Charlena

customer_reviews.title: I can't watch my TV!
customer_reviews.text: I've had trouble watching my TV from the first day it was set up! The picture skips ahead, then it gets blurry, then it pixelates. It happens more on certain channels. Samsung said I should call Spectrum but now I've had 6 people from Spectrum come over to my apartment to try and solve the problem. I've even had supervisors. They told me, no, it seems to be your TV. Now it looks like I can't return my TV after September 3rd?!! Well I've been trying to get it fixed all this time but nothing has been working. I just bought this TV!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Bessette

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Item came damaged. Screen was damaged. Package and styrofoam both ok but TV was not
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Great Outdoor tv.
customer_reviews.text: Used outdoors. The automatic contrast provides a great picture under all weather conditions. Picture is very crisp. Colors are great. Screen does reflect sunlit shiny surfaces. Best picture in evening. Used with sound bar, but built in speaker was quite adequate. Automatic installation connected to our wifi network. We connected to our indoor dish receiver with a hdmi splitter so living room and deck share same show with great quality. Mounted under awning in weather protective shell. Will take in during winter.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Daniels

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL PICTURE.
customer_reviews.text: THE PRICE WAS COMPETITIVE, AND THE SHIPMENT WAS CARFUL AND QUICK! REMOTE a little cheezy, but works fine. The color and picture quality is excellent.! the bracket is a little iffy to set up. but is installed finally and stable. just missing some washers. definitely need 2 people to hang tv of this size 50" on bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Va Sorrell

customer_reviews.title: Description says one thing, specs says another.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this with the intent on Motion Rate 120 for the 120 Hz. In Description it says that the item has 120 Hz. Then with no indication that the 50" would be half the refresh rate of the 75" Would've been great to know that the different sizes was at different rates prior to buying. Great TV, but very annoying that they would lie about the refresh rates.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Smith II

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve done my research on about 5 different tv’s and models. This one by far was the better tv for the price. The picture quality is really clear and the crisp. I tried watching a few movies that had a lot of CGI in it, ie: Black Panther, Avengers movies, and I’m amazed by the color and picture quality. I am very satisfied with my purchase and I would definitely buy this tv again if I need one for my other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Aplan

customer_reviews.title: I love this TV
customer_reviews.text: Samsung has never been on my radar due to price. This TV change my mind for the better. We have the 43 inch and the 55 inch versions, and will be purchasing the 75 inch version for our theater room. Picture quality is fantastic. The game mode looks great on my Xbox One X. Apple AirPlay integration works well. Auto-brightness is a great feature when setup correctly. The price is amazing for what you get. If I had to pick one thing, I'd say the remote is a little goofy. However, we primarily use the Apple TV remote or the Fire TV remote which most people would do, so this is almost a non-issue.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Terms and Conditions Issues are nearly always caused by YOUR network!
customer_reviews.text: I am a seasoned PC tech and deal with network issues all the time. That said, I could not get this TV to complete the Terms and Conditions (registration) details for nearly 3 days. If you run into anything like this, you should seriously consider reconfiguring your network to very minimal pieces (cablemodem, wireless router) and nothing more. Devices like Pi-Hole, etc. can and will interfere with this registration process. Once that was completed, this TV is a really nice upgrade from my 7 year old 55 inch one. The smarthub stuff is excellent and the quality of the picture is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: RickH

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, quick shipment
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine TV for the price. Not really sure what others were complaining about with regards to the setup (even though judging by the slight racism of one of the reviewers I can see why he wouldn’t know how to set up a tv, just a heads up DVD person, all tech in one way or another comes from Asia/China/South Korea so get over yourself) Disable the smart features, buy an Apple TV, and this makes for a world class experience.
customer_reviews.author: John Steers

customer_reviews.title: Great TV, low price.
customer_reviews.text: I received TV today, July 16. It was very easy to set up, light weight at about 30 pounds. I’ve read some bad reviews on this TV but I was very impressed with how well Samsung put a great TV on the market for such a low price. I would check the internet for picture adjustments, sound was ok, I used my old sound system but the TV’s build in was ok. Great TV for the price, if I have trouble later I’ll repost.
customer_reviews.author: Sue B.

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating/ buyers remorse
customer_reviews.text: They are requiring a Samsung account to be created to use the smart tv functions. I have more than enough accounts with companies. I really don't want to have to create another one. I am absolutely against this kind of entrapment. It also does not have an app available for Beach Body, which we use every day. Now we have to plug a fire stick into it to be able to use our apps. As a smart tv it is useless. Hate this device for these reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tv but dim picture, issues connecting to cable
customer_reviews.text: Reviews about brightness are accurate. Very dim and no way to brighten. Having issues connecting to my cable box. Not sure if it’s an issue with the hdmi cable, the hdmi 1 port, or just my cable provider but will update once i find out. Calling my cable provider tomorrow. Would love to be able to brighten the picture but don’t see any options that allow it.
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Nice TV for My Bedroom
customer_reviews.text: I really like this television. The size was just right for my master bedroom, and the picture clarity is good. I was surprised at the smart features. I've never been a fan of smart televisions, and instead have always used a PS4 or FireTV instead. I actually unhooked my FireTV from this set soon after I mounted it on my wall. The built-in FireTV features are perfectly fine, and it has a bunch of free channels with SamsungTV to boot. The remote is simplistic but intuitive. All in all, I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Beware ordering online
customer_reviews.text: After arranging installers, then removing my current flatscreen, then getting this one up on the wall...the screen looked like a spiderweb of cracks. We noticed a small dent at the bottom, but when we turned it on, the entire screen was shattered. Such an incredible aggravation and waste of time. Apparently this 65" tv is too fragile to be shipped. I will repurchase it from a big box store locally. We are all so disappointed. It looks like a beautiful flatscreen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst Decision
customer_reviews.text: This TV is terrible. It stopped working within three weeks and Samsung's customer service department is as helpful as the DMV.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great TV overall
customer_reviews.text: I love this TV. The picture is beautiful. I do have two issues I have with this TV though. First is it's a little glitchy. It has trouble staying connected to my wifi occasionally and it will also randomly change to the Samsung TV app in the middle of the night and it ends up blaring crappy music that wakes me up. The other issue is I hate the remote. The buttons are so sensitive so with the slightest accidental touch it will leave the app I am using to go to another. Not a big deal if it happens occasionally, but this happens to me every day, and it has become pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C

customer_reviews.title: Good TV but Worst Remote Ever !!!
customer_reviews.text: The remote control is supposed to make TV control simple. Most remote control units do that. The 7-button remote control that came with this TV makes the control stupidly complicated. I chose to buy a good 50-button 3rd party controller for about $10 (at Amazon). Still, Samsung needs to send their remote control designers to USER FRIENDLY SCHOOL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I was not entirely sure whether this TV would be "overwhelming" in size, but it is really a great size for the room and not at all like I installed a drive-in theater. I have a Bose surround sound system and the optical port and options for using the BOSE control to run the TV and the sound worked great! Watched football and it was like I sitting in the [fan-less] stadium. Very happy with this purchase and the quality of this TV. Hard to beat this for the price at this size.
customer_reviews.author: R. English

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am re Writting my review after a few months of having it. This TV to put it simply sucks. It is a cheapo. The remote is so weird. Every time u add a item to the HDMI it will connect and start to play ads. The TV itself will need reconnected to WIFI every other day. The picture quality is good but that’s it. Not to mention, if you plan to not mount it, then good luck. This thing is wobbly on the legs it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Love the tv replaces a computer Apple TV or hdmi mirroring
customer_reviews.text: I love the tv and everything about it. Add delete rearrange apps and even has a search engine which what I wanted. I would give it a 9.5. Changing the channel and the volume was a little challenging to figure out I thought you need to press but it did not do anything later I realize you slighting move it either from the top or bottom the volume and channels slightly moves. It does everything that the Apple TV or google Comcast would do no need to have both
customer_reviews.author: zaineb

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase 85”
customer_reviews.text: Happy with my purchase the picture and features are good enough for me . I did a lot of research online before this purchase and quickly became overwhelmed with the over Analysis of picture quality, refresh rate , dark contrast , screen reflection , screen brightness for your room . Bottom line is the picture looked good to me and all the other stuff I am sure for professionals is important but I couldn’t tell . I purchased the 85” viewing from 12 feet away and am happy with it . The Apple Air Play works great to connect with iPhone or Mac Book for screen mirroring.
customer_reviews.author: CalBoy

customer_reviews.title: Go find a better tv
customer_reviews.text: I thought this woyld be a good investment but in all honesty..not a good product...its so confusing to configure the tv settings half the time it says that 4k isnt compatible with certain devices that run 4k, the picture is pretty messed up, showing way to dark even at full brightness and you have to pick between brightness with horrid color saturation or good color saturation with no brightness...not gonna lie, they dropped the ball on this model
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm returning this
customer_reviews.text: the chassis is very flimsy. you can feel the screen heat from 2 feet away The color terrible. no matter how I try the settings. chromecast is not built-in it's alexa/amazon/samsung native software - which is junk LOL...my 5 year old Sony is better.
customer_reviews.author: MacKenzie L

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and Sloppy
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is great. The physical design is minimal and attractive. The quick set up is terrible. I was pretty much on my own. The manual is in the TV and took me 30 minutes to find where it was along with the settings. Click the home button and using the wheel on the remote scroll left. The setup took over an hour. The next challenge was hooking up my existing Samsung sound bar. That was an even better treat. That took me 3 days to finally get it right. I can’t wait to try creating a universal remote.
customer_reviews.author: Star Struck

customer_reviews.title: We found 55” Samsung TU8000 is a great and value buy with fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: I have read quite a few reviews on this product which a lot of people found it disappointing, but we decided to give it a try. Amazingly, we love it very much. Design wise, it’s slim and sleek, like last year 8000-series. It’s noted that the specs are more similar to last year 7000-series so does the starting retail price, which I found it to be reasonable. I didn’t experience any technical issue with the software installation, esp with Netflix that I read about online. Overall, we found it to be a great and value buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lim Chieh Ping

customer_reviews.title: Just OK- disappointed overall
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to upgrade my 40” to a 65” and my parents have an awesome Samsung TV. I thought the price was too good to be true and honestly it was. The tv is a little slow to respond on startup. It loses internet connection frequently and sounds a drop signal often. I cannot stream from my phone up to the TV without skipping. I noticed the TV is dim, and the brightness doesn’t go any higher. I’m not sure I’m keeping it only because it’s such a pain to send back... but I wouldn’t buy this model again. I’d go for something brighter and faster
customer_reviews.author: Rrjenney

customer_reviews.title: No back
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid ($999.98), this is a super awesome TV. Very easy to set up, and no faulty pixels, or other typical problems which plague budget large screen TV’s. The picture is great and very customizable....except as to brightness. There is no backlight, hence the image is on the darker side and the TV should not be placed in a sunny room. I wish I knew this before getting it because the TV was for a sunny room. After spending a few hours adjusting the settings, the TV looks pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Handsome B. Wonderful

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great tv!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Picture quality is crisp, however, you do have to adjust it to remove that soap opera effect. Sound is pretty good too considering how terrible the sound on flat screen TVs can be. I was actually really impressed by the weight of this tv, a 55 inch is only 31lbs. I personally like Samsung’s interface and the free cable channels. The new samsung remote is a clean design and worked with my Apple TV which was a plus. I also like the ambient mode, which basically turns the tv into a painting. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Received much more than I thought I expected!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing TV and quality at such a great price. I was very amazed not only at the high picture quality and sound quality but also the many extras that Samsung includes in all their products including using voice Alexa. The setup was “fantastic” because it was so easy using the internet and a Samsung account from a previous TV. The remote & internet walked me through the rest and it look like a professional. The remote is still a little difficult using with my cable system, but with Netflix, DVD, Amazon Prime etc it’s much easier. The only problem is that sometimes my Alexa TV app and Alexa thermostat often both answer me, if you call that a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty picture but problems everywhere else
customer_reviews.text: From day 1 TV makes a clicking sound every minute or so when on (and for ~15 minutes after being turned off). Working on getting a repair person from Samsung to come and fix it. Ads are built into the home navigation bar with no option to remove. All apps I've tried (Netflix, prime, iHeartRadio, Disney) all work well with no issues. Remote has no lights so using it in a dark room is hard. The picture quality is great and works well in my office with some light during the day and looks very black at night. Sound is good without adding a soundbar (if I ignore the clicking already mentioned).
customer_reviews.author: Quint

customer_reviews.title: It's a Samsung
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first Samsung TV on Amazon last year (2019) model and loved it's picture quality, ease set-up and its use. Ont year later I purchased this one for my bedroom which I use the most. It's a great size for my room size and from time-to-time I catch myself when watching, admiring its crystal clear picture quality. Plus, I like that Samsung has a built-in TV app to watch programming. I'm very pleased with my Samsung choice!
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: Not for daytime viewing
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry I purchased this TV - the reflection from a window (with blinds) makes it almost impossible to see clearly, also you cannot see anything unless you are right in front of the picture. My favorite viewing spot is no longer my spot - can't see picture at all if you're not right in front - looks like a gray wall from my favorite spot. I'm not happy. I hate this tv.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Carreiro

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: The TV arrived and the package was in great condition. I unboxed the tv and it looked great. Set up all the smart features and turned on Netflix. As I was about 20 minutes into a show the tv just went black and sound turned off. I trouble shooted the tv and still nothing would make it turn back on. There was a faint burnt electrical smell from the TV as well. Not sure if it blew a circuit or what. 2 stars because the TV only worked for 20 minutes and phone call to Amazon was easy and all ready have a replacement on the way at no extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good TV for the money
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this, I was not sure about the seller. NO issues. Received in 2 day's from purchase. No issues using the carrier. TV arrived in good shape, worked as expected. Happy thus far with all the experience. I needed to replace an ancient TV in the bedroom and this was perfect for that need. Happy Camper.
customer_reviews.author: Mike E

customer_reviews.title: Not happy that I purchased this television.
customer_reviews.text: Constantly loses wifi signal. Have had to reset the television 4 times in the month since it was installed. Moved the router across the house so it is only a few feet away and it still is spotty. Live TV on any app doesn’t work. Sometimes it just won’t come on at all, and we have to unplug/replug it to get it to work. Our older Samsung across the house has no issues at all connecting. This model seems like a bit of a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Doss

customer_reviews.title: Would be better without "smart" functionality
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - It's a large TV with a nice form factor - Relatively cheap among 4K TVs of this size Cons: - I had some color issues initially and had to modify the settings to get certain games/movies to look natural. - The Smart TV software is absolute garbage. The homescreen includes random advertisements and channels that I don't care about, and multiple apps don't work well. E.g., streaming with accompanying iOS app results in choppy audio and slow-to-refresh video. The Hulu app freezes whenever an ad plays. I purchased a Chromecast so that I could avoid using the "smart" features as much as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas T.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price for TV
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this purchase. We bought this for a Father’s Day gift for my husband. He is thrilled with it. Picture quality is amazing. The size was perfect for our wall. Easy to connect, smart apps are easy to navigate, install and use. The remote is decent wish it was a bit bigger, easy to lose but hey aren’t they all? Happy with everything about this tv. Reviewing after 2 months of use here’
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi & David Blake

customer_reviews.title: Value Price
customer_reviews.text: Sharp/crisp picture. Volume level not that great for watching movies(purchased a sound bar), all the smart tv(channels) features are ok, not really needed, should have local channels as well, but a great buy for a 50in. smart 4k tv.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Meighan

customer_reviews.title: Very user UNfriendly
customer_reviews.text: The controls are overly complex and restrictive. It looks like you can rearrange apps, but they only actually move if they want to! (Some moved and some did not.) Samsung reserves the right to randomly choose what apps cannot be uninstalled, or apps that cannot be removed from the home screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't even understand how this even made it to the floor!
customer_reviews.text: Actually the worst purchase I've made to this date. I actually can't even explain how many issues I've had with this television. Put it like this I would rather have a old school turn knob!.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K.

customer_reviews.title: Dead Pixels in 60 days
customer_reviews.text: TV had an excellent picture and lots of great features. However, in fewer than 60 days of use the TV started to have lines of dead pixels extend from the left side. Spent hours with Samsung support, got multiple run-arounds, and they will not replace it due to their own "lack of inventory." Spent a few more hours with Samsung support and will now finally will get a refund. But not until I dismount the TV and have one of their shipping carriers pick-up/return it. Previously a loyal customer of Samsung products. Switching to LG now.
customer_reviews.author: danielle treacy

customer_reviews.title: Samsung tv
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive tv, so far it’s very good with minimal issues. The tv can be somewhat dark on some scenes, the speakers on the tv can be a bit on the low side, and sometimes it lags. However, overall it is great if you are on a budget and don’t care if it doesn’t have the little stuff like having a backlight on the control. Ps. The measurement on the tv such as the 43 inch tv is the measurement, diagonally and not the width of the tv.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Palma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent TV. Impressive internal sound.
customer_reviews.text: What a great deal. Excellent picture quality and great features. Easy to set up Alexa and all streaming apps. Got this for screened in porch and could not be happier. I am also an audiophile. I purchased a sound bar to install below because most TV’s built in speakers are garbage. However, when I started watching it without the bar, I was impressed by the rich bass and dialogue was easy to hear. Decided to send back the bar. Great TV.
customer_reviews.author: hillkil

customer_reviews.title: Does not have google assistant even if the box says so
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to a larger and smarter tv. The box shows it has google assistant, however it only shows Bixby and Alexa as an option. My house is set up on google so this really sucks after the tv is now fully installed.
customer_reviews.author: Everman123

customer_reviews.title: Tv review
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is good. Sound is terrible. I am changing the volume constantly, from 18 to 80. Also, the sound is. Not sharp. I do not like the fact that the on/off and volume Are controlled by the tv remote and I am not able to control it at all with my service providers (Comcast) remote. Just a nuisance. I would have liked to send it back, but after imposing on my nieces to set it up for me, I felt I should not. I wish I could give a good review, but I cannot.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie A Kozub

customer_reviews.title: Picture good. Setup bad. Sound bad.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is only average for any tv. That means anyone wanting great or even good will need a sound bar. I saw some reviews said it was great but they must still listen to an AM radio in their car with one speaker in the center dash I guess. I've been a loyal Samsung customer for 20 years. Gotta say I'm disappointed. I sent it back. You get what you pay for is still true. Tv plus soundbar? Cheaper by far to buy the Sony. Which I did. Very happy but not exactly a fair comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok but maybe not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The TV is the perfect size. The only issue is the yellow hue on the top left and bottom right corners of the TV. Other then that, the TV would be perfect. (Size, style, picture clarity) But those hues are distracting
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Damaged during Shipment
customer_reviews.text: When TV arrived, I noticed the box had a hole you could put your fist through. (Not good). Upon further inspection of the box, the container appeared to have been opened and re sealed. Plus the box looked very warn. (not new). When I pulled the tv out of the box, I saw that the tv screen had deep scratches and had been chipped. Unbelievable! ! In my opinion......the damage to the tv screen did not match where the hole in the box was.
customer_reviews.author: James Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great TV with a great picture and is alexa approved
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is WOW. This TV is nice. The picture is great. Picture is clear even when your on the side of the tv. This TV integrates with the fire stick. I am using the tv's remote to control the fire stick. The smart software works without any lag. It has a bunch of free channels from the internet. I will update this in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: ok, the picture and sound on this tv and sound bar are nothing short of amazing. the setup and remote control are some of the most poorly thought out i have ever seen. it would have been nice if they included actual instructions on how their very expensive electronics worked. had i known how difficult it was to set this up i would never have purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: bigJ

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my PS4
customer_reviews.text: Pros: •price for what you’re getting •beautiful picture quality •great WiFi antenna •bright picture on dynamic mode. •vivid colors •HDR is pretty good. •the controller is super responsive. It makes typing and browsing super easy. Cons: •game mode makes the screen really dark. I turned game mode off completely... it even made duplicates of moving objects. •only an optical audio output. If you want to hook up a stereo system without a controller you’re going to have to walk over to turn the volume up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Big Red Dots
customer_reviews.text: I only buy Samsung TVs and this model seems to have big issues. The 43 inch 8 series has great features and an even better remote... However, there is a problem with this series of 43 having big red dots across the screen (see photos). This was the 3rd try with this model. The first, ordered from Best Buy had the dots as well. So, I returned it and ordered one from Amazon which arrived cracked down the middle. I returned that one for what you see in the photos, yep... Big Red Dots. I returned this one and went to Best Buy and purchased the 7 series 43. Great picture, Great Apps, mediocre remote.
customer_reviews.author: H. pullen

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: SAMSUNG 50-inch Class Crystal UHD TU-8000 Series - 4K UHD HDR Smart TV with Alexa Built-in (UN50T) Was impressed by the clarity. Features were easy ti use. Remote is meh. Took some trial and error to figure it out. I like the ease of use when connecting a Bluetooth device. Almost seamless. I use a Boise speaker to get the sound at my desk without entertaining the whole house. I turned it on and the menu asked me if i wanted to use it, That simple. You can control the speaker volume using the remote. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jamz

customer_reviews.title: Great TV for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a smaller Samsung for my bedroom and really enjoyed it so when our 50in Vizio in the living room started to get buggy I decided to buy a 50in Samsung 4K UHD. Absolutely love the TV. Great picture, no grey areas as some reviewers talked about, and love that it is Alexa controlled. Would be better if I could edit the names of some of the inputs but overall it connected quickly and recognized all my add on equipment. Too bad you cannot totally get rid of some of the preloaded apps but no one lets you do that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The second after setup I immediately noticed clouding and flash lighting in the corners and around the screen. I first purchased the 58’’ one model under and had the same problem so I returned it spent more money and upgraded to this tv and ended up having the same problem but worse. The money we spent on tv’s we shouldn’t have issues. I read up on solutions and what I found was people saying don’t set to dynamic turn ur brightness done and blah blah so basically ur tv becomes a turd. Setting are for a reason if I can’t get what Samsung advertises then what’s the point
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: SAMSUNG 50-inch Class Crystal UHD Television-🤗
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike and I am ecstatic about my television! I bought it to replace a television that was knocked over by one of my many cats! A good friend came over and set everything up for me and I can't stop smiling! 😁This is a fantastic buy and well worth the price! I need a new stand because the stand I had for my other television is not large enough for this one! I will recommend this television to all of my friends and neighbors! Sorry I don't know how to include a picture! 🤗🤗
customer_reviews.author: Judi R. Gandy

customer_reviews.title: Wifi adapter was bugged on unboxing.  65 inch
customer_reviews.text: After two weeks of streaming, this tv was unable to stay connected to my wifi . Despite the signal being full. It was a huge inconvenience ; seeing that all of the most vital functionality of the Tv depends on wifi Connection. Also the Tv dosent have usb 2.1 ports. For a tv designed in 2020 thats a huge dissapointment because this means it will not be able to support 4k120 for ps5 and xbox series x. I wouldn’t recommend this for anyone that actually needs a monitor . More like something for people who need a display in the kids room or something. REFUND!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Leon m

customer_reviews.title: High-End TV works 5 days Samsung would not replace
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 43” Samsung Series 8 TV from Amazon. The setup was easy, the picture was terrific however, it only lasted 5 days. I contacted Samsung support And was told they could not replace it only repair it. It was 5 days old, considered dead-out-of-box but would not replace. They sent a technician to my home to repair but he could not fix it And had to take it to the shop to repair. This was not a cheap, disposable TV, it was a top-of-the-line Series 8 UHD unit. I purchased in good faith from Amazon and Samsung and I still have no TV. I’ll never buy another Samsung product and will use Amazon as my last resort only.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Loman

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage ! Samsung used to be good now they went down. You cant use tv untill you agree to terms and conditions which are downloded from server which never works , then when you try to agree them in "smartthings" it gives error . Pointless POS
customer_reviews.author: LukeM

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality - defective screen within one day of use
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a great TV out of the box, but after one day of use a white line appeared in the middle of the screen. Samsung support said it was a defective screen and would need to be replaced. I noticed that this happened with another customer in the reviews as well. I would not buy this TV.
customer_reviews.author: colton

customer_reviews.title: Bang for buck!
customer_reviews.text: We love this tv. Yes it is entry level. The only thing i have found so far is that it is not great in direct sunlight. Big deal. Dont take it out side. 😁 Seriously though, it has lots of bells and stuff. Nice picture, good sound. Lots of input options. For a entry level 50 inch tv i would say thid will hold its own against all comers.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Constant audio and video lag regardless of input or streaming. I also did not pay for a tv to have forced advertisements shoved in my face. These TVs have ads you have to pass thru to get to settings on the tv using the remote. Until these shady practices are done away with, I will not be purchasing further Samsung products.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: too smart for me !!!  Should of stayed with Sony.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to operate. If i press wrong button it take a while to correct or I turn tv off and restart .Buying a new all in one remote to replace. A couple of buttons don't do there task and take to another area which can't figue how to get out. So i often just turn tv off and back on. The fast forward & rewind don't button no good.In the 6 weeks i found multi compaints of the remote an google ,you tube etc. Very disapointed in Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Mchale

product_meta.title: SAMSUNG 55-Inch Class Crystal UHD TU-8000 Series - 4K UHD HDR Smart TV with Alexa Built-in (UN55TU8000FXZA, 2020 Model)
product_meta.description: Style:TV Only| Size:55-InchExperience your favorite movies and shows on a vibrant, stunning 4K UHD screen, using the Universal Guide to surf smoothly and select content. Everything you watch is automatically upscale into 4K for stunningly vivid color and detail.
feature_bullets: Crystal processor 4K: This ultra-fast processor transforms everything you watch into stunning 4K.
Multi voice: Smart TV with Alexa and Bixby.
Smart TV powered by Tizen: Go beyond Smart TV with next-gen apps, super easy control, and a host of enhancements that elevate the TV watching experience.
HDR: Unveils shades of color you can't find on HDTV.
Crystal display: Experience crystal clear colors that are fine-tuned to deliver a naturally crisp and vivid picture.

Alexa built-in: Ask more from your TV. Just ask Alexa to open apps, change the channel, search for movies and shows, play music, control your smart home devices and more. To talk to Alexa, press and hold the mic button on your remote.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,278 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
